revised_title: Meteorological Observations Using Kites off the West Coast of Scotland in 1902
tldr: This article discusses the use of kites for meteorological observations off the west coast of Scotland in 1902. The authors describe their experimental setup, methods, and results, including temperature and humidity readings at various heights. They found that using a steam vessel for kite operations was advantageous, as it allowed for more ascents in calmer weather conditions.
